content.description: No crux, just really fun climbing. Cool chimney at the top that doesn't require any chimney'ing.
content.protection: 3 bolts and anchors.
content.location: On the other face of Strawberry Razzle Tea.

content.description: Start either left of the bolt on the crack, or go straight up. Use a quad to avoid rope drag for top rope. Rap down.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a surface-rusted anchor.
content.location: As you enter Lower Looner Land crag, you'll see a few 5.10/5.9 climbs. As you turn left and see the Strawberry Razzle Tea pinnacle 90* from there, turn another 90* and you'll see a small little rock with some bolts.

content.description: The bolted line is about a 5.5, but two other lines are available once the anchor is set. There is a near vertical face with 2-finger pockets just right of the bolt line which is maybe 5.8+ for the first 15 feet, and further right is a 5.3 line still protected by the top anchors. You can scramble up the back to set a top rope too. One of the few easy climbs without significant distance between bolts in Queen Creek, makes a low risk first lead.
content.protection: 3 bolts with 2 bolt anchor, sling/quad needed for belay as the anchor is set back from the edge.
content.location: This route is on a shorter buttress between the ride the wild and gumby patrol buttresses.

content.description: Ramp leads to a ledge, a small bulge, and then to the top.  The first bolt is lower than that of the neighboring Snorkeling, which makes it a less daunting lead.   *this may be on the Marty Map, I need to check)
content.protection: 3 bolts to chains.
content.location: A few paces to the right of Snorkeling in the Rhyolite

content.description: Climb face over bulge. Route originally only had 3 bolts, bolts 2, 4 and 6(who but 2 Polacks with a Hilti would do such a thing!). Additional bolts were added later by first ascent party due to community feedback.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chains.
content.location: Route left of Three Bulges and a Baby

content.description: One move--fun move--wonder!
content.protection: 4 bolts and a pair of anchor bolts.
content.location: On the face just left of Ride the Wild

content.description: from the wash, its on the west side of one of the towers near the top of the hill. Northeast of Ride the wild
content.protection: bolts

content.description: Fun route.  Starts with low slope transitioning to vertical.
content.protection: 3 bolt face to a two bolt top anchor/ rap
content.location: Last face in NE corner of the ridge that makes Lower Looner Land.

content.description: 6 bolts up the nose of this prominent fin. Easy, thrilling moves. About as fun as sport climbing can get.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a pair of anchor bolts.
content.location: THE fin in Lower Looner Land

content.description: Thin start to a highish bolt.  More thin moves up and left to another bolt that also seems just a tad higher than you would want it to be.  Ok--now catch a good rest!  Start slightly overhanging crux finish.  Sequencey on tons of slopey pockets.
content.protection: 4 bolts + 2 bolt anchor from which you can rap
content.location: Located on the fin just west of Ride the Wild.  A route called Grasping for Straws is just left of this route.  The exact location can be found in Marty Karabin's fold-out topo for The Mine.

content.description: Large looking crack above short slab. Climb easiest rock below the crack to start. Climb crack to top!
content.protection: Standard rack small - #5 BD 2 bolt anchor and easy walk off
content.location: Head to lower looner lands from Parking area. Find the gully with ride the wild and walk north towards the back of the moon floss formation that is lower looner proper! On your left hand side in between two bolt lines is a crack. This is it!

content.description: Thin climbing that starts up a face with a shallow seam to the right (and back a bit) from Camper Van Beethoven. There's a prominent crack just to it's left (The Grand Titon, 5.7)
content.protection: 3 bolts with old plated SMC hangers plus a bizarre new one 6" below the two anchor bolts.

content.description: Found the crux between 1 and 2. Also, thought the route harder then the given rating of 5.9
content.protection: Crummy belay. Three (3) lead bolts.
content.location: The first route on the left side of the formation that has Camper Van Beethoven and Grasping for Straws.

climbs.name: Leopard gecko
climbs.fa: FA Aaron Peterson, FFA Aaron Collins, Ben albrecht

content.description: Clip bolt and mantle ledge, clip second bolt and climb right of the bolt to the top! Route bolted on lead!
content.protection: 2 bolts and a bolt to belay at the top shared with horny lizard
content.location: Walk from parking area to lower looner lands. Once at LLL find ride the wild and look north up a gully. Walk up the gully and on the right will be a 2 bolt line!

climbs.name: Horny lizard
climbs.fa: Carlos Valenzuela, ben albrecht, Alexis ely

content.description: Climb crack to top, short route that shares belay bolt  with nearby route
content.protection: Few tiny cams and a hand sized piece. 1 bolt belay at top shared with leopard gecko. Walk off when your finished!
content.location: Head to lower looner lands from the parking area. Identify “ride the wild”. From RTW head north just past 3 baby’s and a bulge to a 2 bolt line and thin cracks.

content.description: Follow bolts up the sandy face then head left at the roof and climb up to 2 bolt anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Second and fifth are cruxes. You can clip the first bolt easily.
content.location: Left of Strawberry Razzle Tea on the next pinnacle. Belay on ledge.

content.description: Thin face climbing with a low crux
content.protection: 3 bolts. The anchor situation on top makes it challenging to clean this route. You will need to rap the tower in a different direction. bring long webbing if you want to TR.
content.location: Located on the leftside of a pair of cute short towers. It's about 100 yards down the hill from Snorkeling in the Rhyolite. These climbs are pretty much the first you come to as you walk up the wash from the parking area.

content.description: A varied technical face route that we thought harder then its given rating of 5.9. It sees a great deal of traffic and has probably eroded up in difficulty.
content.protection: Four (4) bolts to its own anchors.
content.location: The next route over right from Mary Jane.

content.description: From Weekend Rock Arizona: Trad and Sport Routes from 5.0 to 5.10a by Lon Abbot: "This is a fun and unusual climb for Queen Creek. Climb the prominent chimney to the off-width crack that splits the buttress. Stoppers and several large cams are needed to lead it. This climb may also be top roped off the Moon Floss anchors if you bring a #2 or #2.5 cam for a directional at the top of the crack. Descent: Rap off the Moon Floss anchors or walk off.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor at the top with chains.
content.location: Right to the left of moon floss

climbs.name: Daughter
climbs.fa: Dana Hollister, Mike Morris, Jill Boyton, 1/94

content.description: Route around on the east side of the formation that has Moon Floss and Camper Van Beethoven. Climb up face past bolt to ledge, then continue to top past three more bolts to anchor.
content.protection: Bolts

content.description: Fun slab to a Queen Creek style first bolt. Basically a V2 boulder problem at 35' with a hairy top out.
content.protection: 3 bolts. 3rd bolt is a spinner and needs to be replaced.   Walk off or rap down from a set of unequalized bolts left of route.
content.location: On the 3rd blade in lower lunar, up the obvious overhang.

content.description: Stay on the face for a more challenging route. Route goes to the left and up the chimney/arete for a low grade top out.
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear further up if desired. shares 2 bolt anchor with SRT
content.location: Left of Strawberry Razzle Tea. On the second wall west of Snorkeling in the Rhyolite. Rap down.

content.description: Lower Looner Land is the section of pinnacles found just south and a bit west of the parking area. The formations here mostly feature positive edges with the occasional deep pocket, although there are some pretty good finger tweakers here as well.
